name: Daylily
climate: Daylilies thrive in a climate that provides seasonal changes.
They are well suited for regions with cold winters and warm summers.
Daylilies can endure periods of drought once established.
Generally hardy in USDA zones 4 through 9, tolerating varied conditions.
sunlight: Daylilies perform best in full sunlight for at least six hours daily.
Partial shade is tolerated but can result in fewer blooms.
They will grow in partly shaded conditions, like under trees.
For optimal flowering, avoid placing in heavy shade locations.
watering: Water daylilies regularly during their first growing season.
Once established, they can tolerate some periods of dryness.
Consistent watering leads to the best blooming performance.
Avoid overwatering as it can cause root rot or fungal issues.
soil: Daylilies prefer well-drained soil to avoid water logging.
They are not fussy and can grow in a range of soil types.
Loamy soil enriched with organic matter is beneficial.
Ensure the planting site has good drainage to prevent issues.
extra_care_tip: Deadhead spent blooms and trim foliage for tidiness.
Divide clumps every few years to manage overcrowding.
Mulching can help retain soil moisture and control weeds.
Apply a balanced fertilizer in early spring for strong growth.
